sen.j: 柳原 愛子（やなぎはら なるこ、安政6年5月26日 (旧暦)（1859年6月26日） - 10月16日）は、明治天皇の典侍。
sen.e: Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA (June 26th, 1859, to October 16th, 1943) was a 'Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank)' to the Emperor Meiji.
Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA (June 26, 1859, to October 16, 1943) was a Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank) to the Emperor Meiji.
sen.cmt: 日付表記を統一しました。原文に没年がありません。引用符が全角、かつ不要のため削除しました。
sen.e: Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA (June 26, 1859, to October 16, 1943) was a Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank) to the Emperor Meiji.

sen.j: 大正天皇の母。
sen.e: Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA was the mother of the Emperor Taisho.
Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA is the mother of the Emperor Taisho.
sen.cmt: 動詞を現在形に修正しました。
sen.e: Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA is the mother of the Emperor Taisho.

sen.j: 位階の正二位をもって二位の局と称される。
sen.e: Her Ikai (Court rank) was of the Senior Second Court Rank and was referred as the "Nii no tsubone (The second ranking court lady)."
Her Ikai (Court rank) was of the Senior Second Court Rank and was referred as the Nii no tsubone (The second ranking court lady).
sen.cmt: 引用符が全角、かつ不要のため削除しました。
sen.e: Her Ikai (Court rank) was of the Senior Second Court Rank and was referred as the Nii no tsubone (The second ranking court lady).

sen.j: 女房名は梅ノ井、早蕨内侍など。
sen.e: As a court lady, she would be given names such as: Umenoi and Sawarabi naiji.
As a court lady, she would be given names such as: Umenoi and Sawarabi naiji.
As a court lady, she would be given names such as: Umenoi and Sawarabi naiji.

sen.j: 幕末の議奏・権中納言正二位 柳原光愛の次女。
sen.e: Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA was the second daughter of Mitsunaru YANAGIWARA, who was a giso (a position conveying what the congress decides to the emperor) at the end of Edo Period; and his title was Gon Chunagon, Deputy Middle Counselor, Senior Second Court Rank.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA was the second daughter of Mitsunaru YANAGIWARA, who was a giso (a position conveying what the congress decides to the emperor) at the end of Edo Period; and his title was Gon Chunagon, Deputy Middle Counselor, Senior Second Court Rank.

Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA was the second daughter of Mitsunaru YANAGIWARA, who was a giso (a position conveying what the congress decides to the emperor) at the end of Edo Period; and his title was Gon Chunagon, Deputy Middle Counselor, Senior Second Court Rank.

sen.j: 伯爵・柳原前光の妹。
sen.e: In addition she was a sister of Count Sakimitsu YANAGIWARA.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In addition she was a younger sister of Count Sakimitsu YANAGIWARA.
sen.cmt: 妹のため、youngerを追記しました。
sen.e: In addition she was a younger sister of Count Sakimitsu YANAGIWARA.

sen.j: 「筑紫国の女王」柳原白蓮は姪にあたる。
sen.e: Byakuren YANAGIHARA, "Princess of Tsukushi Province," was one of her (Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA) nieces.
Byakuren YANAGIHARA, 'Princess of Tsukushi Province,' was one of her (Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA) nieces.
sen.cmt: 引用符が二重、かつ全角のため修正しました。
sen.e: Byakuren YANAGIHARA, 'Princess of Tsukushi Province,' was one of her (Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA) nieces.

sen.j: 明治3年（1870年）、皇太后宮小上臈として出仕した。
sen.e: In '1870', Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA started her service at the Imperial court as a Kojoro [(certain daughters or granddaughters of daijin (the Ministers of State), nagon (the Counselors), and sangi (the Consultants) and other kugyo (senior nobles)] for the Empress Dowager.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: In 1870, Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA started her service at the Imperial court as a Kojoro (certain daughters or granddaughters of daijin [the Ministers of State], nagon [the Counselors], and sangi [the Consultants] and other kugyo [senior nobles]) for the Empress Dowager.
sen.cmt: 年号の' 'を削除しました。括弧を仕様書に従い修正しました。
sen.e: In 1870, Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA started her service at the Imperial court as a Kojoro (certain daughters or granddaughters of daijin [the Ministers of State], nagon [the Counselors], and sangi [the Consultants] and other kugyo [senior nobles]) for the Empress Dowager.

sen.j: 掌侍（勾当内侍）を経て権典侍となった。
sen.e: Then, she became a 'Naishi no suke' (a court lady of the first rank) after having served as a'Naishi no Jo' [(Koto no Naishi); a woman officer who carries the Emperor's sword when he goes out)].
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Then, she became a Gon no naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank) after having served as a Naishi no Jo (Koto no Naishi [a woman officer who carries the Emperor's sword when he goes out].)
sen.cmt: 権典侍に対して、読みの”Gon no”が訳出漏れのため追記しました。不要な引用符を削除しました。括弧を仕様書に従い修正しました。不要な括弧も削除しました。
sen.e: Then, she became a Gon no naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank) after having served as a Naishi no Jo (Koto no Naishi [a woman officer who carries the Emperor's sword when he goes out].)

sen.j: 明治天皇の宮人となって、第二皇女・梅宮薫子内親王、第二皇子・建宮敬仁親王、第三皇子・明宮嘉仁親王を出産した。
sen.e: Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA became Kyujin (court lady) for the Emperor Meiji and gave birth to three children: The second Imperial Princess, Ume-no-Miya Shigeko; the second Imperial Prince, Take-no-Miya Yukihito; and the third Imperial Prince, Haru-no-Miya Yoshihito.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA became Kyujin (court lady) for the Emperor Meiji and gave birth to three children: The second Imperial Princess, Ume-no-Miya Shigeko; the second Imperial Prince, Take-no-Miya Yukihito; and the third Imperial Prince, Haru-no-Miya Yoshihito.

Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA became Kyujin (court lady) for the Emperor Meiji and gave birth to three children: The second Imperial Princess, Ume-no-Miya Shigeko; the second Imperial Prince, Take-no-Miya Yukihito; and the third Imperial Prince, Haru-no-Miya Yoshihito.

sen.j: が、のちに大正天皇となる嘉仁親王のみが成人できた。
sen.e: However only one child, the Imperial Prince Yoshihito, who later in life would become the Emperor Taisho, would grow to manhood.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: However only one child, the Imperial Prince Yoshihito, who later in life became the Emperor Taisho, could grow to manhood.
sen.cmt: who以下の時制の修正しました。Would=>couldへ原文にあわせて修正しました。
sen.e: However only one child, the Imperial Prince Yoshihito, who later in life became the Emperor Taisho, could grow to manhood.

sen.j: 典侍に任官。
sen.e: Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA was appointed to 'Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank).'
Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA was appointed to Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank).
sen.cmt: 引用符が全角、かつ不要のため削除しました。
sen.e: Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA was appointed to Naishi no suke (a court lady of the first rank).

sen.j: 所生の皇子の即位後、7月正三位皇后宮御用掛・御内儀監督となる。
sen.e: After the enthronement of Prince (Yoshihito), her birth child, in July of 1913, Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA became a Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank), a Goyo-gakari for Empress and Gonaigi Kantoku (a director of court ladies).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After the enthronement of Prince (Yoshihito), her birth child, in July of 1913, Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA became a Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank), a Goyo-gakari for Empress and Gonaigi Kantoku (a director of court ladies).

After the enthronement of Prince (Yoshihito), her birth child, in July of 1913, Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA became a Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank), a Goyo-gakari for Empress and Gonaigi Kantoku (a director of court ladies).

sen.j: 12月1日、従二位に叙された。
sen.e: Then, she received the Junii (Junior Second Rank) on December, 1st, 1915.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Then, she received the Junii (Junior Second Rank) on December 1, 1915.
sen.cmt: 日付表記を統一しました。
sen.e: Then, she received the Junii (Junior Second Rank) on December 1, 1915.

sen.j: 5月10日、勲一等瑞宝章を授けられた。
sen.e: It was on May, 10th, 1925, that Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA received the Grand Cordon in the Order of the Sacred Treasure.
It was on May 10, 1925 that Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA received the Grand Cordon in the Order of the Sacred Treasure.
sen.cmt: 日付表記を統一しました。
sen.e: It was on May 10, 1925 that Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA received the Grand Cordon in the Order of the Sacred Treasure.

sen.j: 12月25日、息子である大正天皇が崩御し、11月には孫である昭和天皇が即位した。
sen.e: On December, 25th, 1926, the Emperor Taisho, her son, met with his demise, and then the Emperor Showa, her grandson, ascended to the throne on November, of 1928.
On December 25, 1926, the Emperor Taisho, her son, met with his demise, and then the Emperor Showa, her grandson, ascended to the throne on November of 1928.
sen.cmt: 日付表記を統一しました。Novemberのあとのカンマを削除しました。
sen.e: On December 25, 1926, the Emperor Taisho, her son, met with his demise, and then the Emperor Showa, her grandson, ascended to the throne on November of 1928.

sen.j: 2月11日、勲一等宝冠章を受章。
sen.e: On February, 11th, 1940, Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA received the First Order of the Precious Crown (Kunitto Hokansho).
On February 11, 1940, Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA received the First Order of the Precious Crown (Kunitto Hokansho).
sen.cmt: 日付表記を統一しました。
sen.e: On February 11, 1940, Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA received the First Order of the Precious Crown (Kunitto Hokansho).

sen.j: 10月16日薨去。
sen.e: It was on October, 16th, 1943, Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA had her Kokyo (death of a man of upper than Third Rank).
It was on October 16, 1943 Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA had her Kokyo (death of a person of upper than Third Rank).
sen.cmt: 日付表記を統一しました。女性の話であるため、Kokyoの説明のなかのmanをpersonへ変更しました。
sen.e: It was on October 16, 1943 Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA had her Kokyo (death of a person of upper than Third Rank).

sen.j: 同日、従一位に追叙。
sen.e: At the same day of her death, Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA received the Juichii (Junior First Rank).
At the same day of her death, Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA received the Juichii (Junior First Rank).
At the same day of her death, Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA received the Juichii (Junior First Rank).

sen.j: 享年84。
sen.e: Her age, at the time of her death was eighty-four.
Her age at the time of her death was eighty-four.
sen.cmt: her ageのあとのカンマ削除しました。
sen.e: Her age at the time of her death was eighty-four.

sen.j: 墓所は東京都目黒区中目黒五丁目の祐天寺にある。
sen.e: Her grave is located in the Yuten-ji Temple, 5th street, Naka Meguro, Meguro Ward, Tokyo.
Her grave is located in the Yuten-ji Temple, 5th street, Naka Meguro, Meguro Ward, Tokyo.
Her grave is located in the Yuten-ji Temple, 5th street, Naka Meguro, Meguro Ward, Tokyo.

sen.j: 和歌に優れ、宮中歌会始に3回撰歌したという。
sen.e: Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA had an excellent talent in the practice of waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) poem creation; her poems were selected for the Utakaihajime (annual New Year's poetry reading) at the Imperial court on three occasions.

Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA had an excellent talent in the practice of waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) poem creation; her poems were selected for the Utakaihajime (annual New Year's poetry reading) at the Imperial court on three occasions.

Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA had an excellent talent in the practice of waka (a traditional Japanese poem of thirty-one syllables) poem creation; her poems were selected for the Utakaihajime (annual New Year's poetry reading) at the Imperial court on three occasions.

sen.j: 明治天皇の没後は準皇族の扱いを受けた。
sen.e: After the death of the Emperor Meiji, Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA was recognized as a person who followed after the Imperial family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: After the death of the Emperor Meiji, Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA was recognized as a person who followed after the Imperial family.
After the death of the Emperor Meiji, Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA was recognized as a person who followed after the Imperial family.

sen.j: 大正天皇臨終の際、貞明皇后の配慮によって枕辺で別れを告げたという逸話を残す。
sen.e: For example, there was an anecdote that Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA was able to say farewell to the Emperor Taisho (her son) in his last moment, at his bedside, this was because of her making an arrangement through the Empress Teimei.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: For example, there was an anecdote that Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA was able to say farewell to the Emperor Taisho (her son) in his last moment, at his bedside, this was because of her making an arrangement through the Empress Teimei.

For example, there was an anecdote that Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA was able to say farewell to the Emperor Taisho (her son) in his last moment, at his bedside, this was because of her making an arrangement through the Empress Teimei.

sen.j: 大正天皇が暗愚であったという風説は大正時代からあった。
sen.e: There were rumors, inferring the Emperor Taisho to of been an imbecile, circulating since the Taisho period.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: There were rumors inferring that the Emperor Taisho had been an imbecile, circulating since the Taisho period.
sen.cmt: inferring the Emperor Taisho to of beenの部分を修正しました。
sen.e: There were rumors inferring that the Emperor Taisho had been an imbecile, circulating since the Taisho period.

sen.j: そのためその遺伝的な根拠を柳原愛子に求め、非難する傾向があった。
sen.e: For this reason, some public opinions expressed in Japan tended to blame Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA, as the birth mother, and providing a genetic cause.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: For this reason, some public opinions expressed in Japan tended to blame Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA, as the birth mother, and providing a genetic cause.
For this reason, some public opinions expressed in Japan tended to blame Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA, as the birth mother, and providing a genetic cause.

sen.j: 8月31日、明治天皇との間に大正天皇（のちの大正天皇・第123代）を出産。
sen.e: On August 31st, 1879, Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA bore a son, the Emperor Taisho (later, the hundred and twenty-third, the Emperor Taisho), with the Emperor Meiji.
On August 31, 1879, Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA bore a son, the Emperor Taisho (later became the hundred and twenty-third emperor, the Emperor Taisho), with the Emperor Meiji.
sen.cmt: 日付表記を統一しました。（ ）内の天皇の説明を修正しました。
sen.e: On August 31, 1879, Ms. Naruko YANAGIHARA bore a son, the Emperor Taisho (later became the hundred and twenty-third emperor, the Emperor Taisho), with the Emperor Meiji.

sen.j: 4月29日、孫である昭和天皇（のちの昭和天皇・第124代）が誕生。
sen.e: It was on April 29th, 1901, a grandson, the Emperor Showa (later, the hundred and twenty-fourth, the Emperor Showa) was borne.
His grandson, the Emperor Showa (later became the hundred and twenty-fourth emperor, the Emperor Showa) was born on April 29, 1901.
sen.cmt: 日付表記を統一しました。（ ）内の天皇の説明を修正しました。Borne=>bornに修正しました。文構造を修正しました。
sen.e: His grandson, the Emperor Showa (later became the hundred and twenty-fourth emperor, the Emperor Showa) was born on April 29, 1901.

sen.j: 12月23日、曾孫である明仁（のちの今上天皇・第125代）が誕生。
sen.e: On December 23rd, 1933, a great-grandchild, Akihito (later, the hundred and twenty-fifth, the present Emperor) was born.
On December 23, 1933, his great-grandchild, Akihito (later became the hundred and twenty-fifth emperor, the present Emperor) was born.
sen.cmt: 日付表記を統一しました。（ ）内の天皇の説明を修正しました。A => hisに修正しました。（great-grandchildの前）
sen.e: On December 23, 1933, his great-grandchild, Akihito (later became the hundred and twenty-fifth emperor, the present Emperor) was born.
